dt-api.name: columns().order()
dt-api.summary: Order the table by the selected columns.

type.description: Determine if the table is being ordered by the selected columns.
type.returns: DataTables API instance containing `-string asc`, `-string desc` or an empty string (indicating index data order) for the possible ordering applied to each column selected. If a selected column is not being ordered on, `null` is given.

type.description: Order the table, in the direction specified, by the columns selected by the `-api columns()` selector.
type.parameter: Direction of sort to apply to the selected columns - `dt-string desc` (descending) or `dt-string asc` (ascending). Note this one direction is applied to all columns from the selector.

dt-api.description:
This method provides a useful alternative to the `-api order()` method, allowing you to select the columns that you want to be ordered using the flexible `-api columns()` selector and having them ordered in the direction specified. As of v2 it also allows you to obtain ordering information about the selected columns - determining if they are used in the current order of the table and what ordering direction.
Multi-column ordering is achieved by ensuring that the column selector matches multiple columns (single column ordering is performed if only one column is matched, or by using the `-api column().order()` method). The order of the matched columns defines the priority sequence in which the ordering of the table is applied.
Please be aware that when used as a setter this method sets the ordering to apply to the table - it does not actually perform the order. To have the ordering performed, use the `-api draw()` method, which can be called simply as a chained method of the `-api order()` method's returned object - for example `table.order([0, 'desc']).draw();`.
